item.title: Prash add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Prash add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The familiarity of superiors embitters one, because it may not be returned." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Prash add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is certainly not the least charm of a theory that it is refutable; it is precisely thereby that it attracts the more subtle minds. It seems that the hundred-times-refuted theory of the "free will" owes its persistence to this charm alone; some one is always appearing who feels himself strong enough to refute it." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Prash add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "And finally, to call to mind the enormous influence which "German philosophy"--I hope you understand its right to inverted commas-" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Prash add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "If a man has character, he has also his typical experience, which always recurs." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Prash add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Happiness consists in frequent repetition of pleasure" -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Prash add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "i have never pondered over questions that are not questions." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Prash add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "It often happens that we blurt out things that may in some kind of way be harmful to us, but we are silent about things that may make us look ridiculous; because in this case effect follows very quickly on cause." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Prash add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description:
"NOT to my contemporaries, not to my compatriots but to mankind I commit my now completed work in the confidence that it will not be without value for them, even if this should be late recognised, as is commonly the lot of what is good. For it cannot have been for the passing generation, engrossed with the delusion of the moment, that my mind, almost against my will, has uninterruptedly stuck to its work through the course of a long life.
preface to the second edition of "the world as will and representation" -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Prash add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "as the "people of the centre" in every sense of the term, the Germans are more intangible, more ample, more contradictory, more unknown, more incalculable, more surprising, and even more terrifying than other peoples are to themselves:--they escape DEFINITION, and are thereby alone the despair of the French." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Prash add a quote by bacon
item.description: "the serpent if it wants to become the dragon must eat itself." -- bacon

item.title: Prash add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "A nation is a detour of nature to arrive at five or six great men- yes, and then to get around them." -- Friedrich Nietzsche
